Seniors 75 years and over as a share of total population
Minority population as a share of total population
Single-parent family as a share all families
Limited English proficiency population as a share of total population 5 years and over
Low Income population as a share of total population for whom poverty status is determined
Disabled population as a share of total civilian noninstitutionalized population
Zero-vehicle households as a share of total households
Severely rent-burdened household as a share of total renter-occupied housing units
Seniors 75 and over make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total poulation in a given Census Tract
Minorities make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total population in a given Census Tract
Single-parent families make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the families in a given Census Tract
Disabled people make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total civilian noninstitutionalized population in a given Census Tract
People with limited English proficiency make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total population 5 years and over in a given Census Tract
Low-income people make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total population for whom poverty status is determined in a given Census Tract
Zero-vehicle households make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of the total households in a given Census Tract
Severely rent-burdened households make up over regional mean plus .5 standard deviation of total renter-occupied housing units in a given Census Tract
The Census Tract meets MTC's Plan Bay Area 2040 Communities of Concern criteria
The Census Tract meets MTC's Plan Bay Area 2050 Communities of Concern criteria
The CoC ranking as determined by standard deviation (sd) from regional mean.
Domain: .5 SD = High; 1 SD = Higher, 1.5 SD = Highest
